segments.text: Hey , Tom , did you enjoy your lunch ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Oh , don't mention it . It was terrible .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: The food station was as crowded as usual . I waited for 20 minutes for my sandwich , and when I finally got it the chicken was underdone .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I see . You simply can't blame the server for this .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Yes , I know . Fast food is so popular in this district .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Anyway , how was your such , Catherine ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: It was good . I brought lunch from home today .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: You did ? I thought you must feel right at home here as we get as many fast food restaurants as you do in America .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Well , I personally don't like them because I don't believe that they are healthy .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I guess you're right . More often than not , people go there only for convenience . The foods may taste good , but generally speaking , they are high in calories , salt and fat .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Yes . I am wondering that you must believe fast food is our lifestyle , don't you ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: You bet . Almost all top brands such as McDonald's and KFC are from America .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Well , actually two-thirds of Americans may avoid these places .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Yeah , it's hard to believe but true .
segments.speaker: S1
